compareDate

public static int compareDate(java.util.Date d1,
                              java.util.Date d2)
Compares two dates. The time fields are ignored.

Parameters:
d1 - - Date 1
d2 - - Date 2
Returns:
0 if same, -1 if d1 is less than d2.

Compares two date objects along with time,

Parameters:
d1 -
d2 -
Returns:
0 if same, -1 if d1 is less and 1 if d1 is higher.

isValidDate

public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date)
Validate a date to be a valid calendar date. Input may come with date "00" which means the date was not indicated, in which case we are going to use 01 just for validation purposes.

Parameters:
date - - the date to be validates
Returns:
boolean - true if the date is valid, false otherwise
